moves.1. a4: A dreadful opening move, even for blitz.
moves.1... c5: Would 2. B4 undermine black's attempt to set up a Sicilian/English opening..?
moves.2... Nc6 3. g3: Finally a sensible move; 3.g3 followed by Bg2 could work together with the a5 push, weakening the B7 square...
moves.3... d5 4. Bg2 Nf6: This move seems natural, as I wish to avoid ...e6.
moves.5. c3: An interesting move.  It is surprisingly difficult to calculate whether white's d4 break would pose a substantial danger...
moves.5... Bg4: A controversial move.  Perhaps black has lost his advantage.
moves.7... e6: Outside of the pawn chain, blacks LSB looks like it can be harried...
moves.8. cxd5 exd5 9. Qa4: I think this threat is easily parried...  Perhaps 9. Nf3 was stronger...
moves.9... Qd7 10. Nc3: Black's position is superior in my view.
moves.10... Be7 11. Nxd5: White is just losing material here.
moves.14. e4 Qd3: I had thought that ...Bh3 followed by Nxh3 and ...Qf3+ was playable, but it is not in light of Nf2.
moves.18. h4 Rfe8: I am not so sure about this move.  Maybe an immediate ...Bd6 was better.
moves.19. h5: I did not want to play ...h6 and risk white's playing d4.
moves.19... Be6 20. Qc3 Bf6 21. h6 g6: And I think black's position will be fine.  Of course, I will have to watch the long diagonal, now that white has attained a thorn pawn -- his only achievement thus far.
moves.22. f4: White is getting some counter play here, after ...Ng4.
moves.22... Ng4 23. e5: Maybe ...Qc6 was good here as well.
moves.23... Nxe5: But I am happy to return the material, with advantage.
moves.24. fxe5 Bxe5 25. Qf3 Bxb2: Not the classiest continuation.  However, I was under time trouble, and was trying to clear the e-file for a discovered check on white's king.
moves.26. Bxb2 Bc4: For the moment, white cannot play Qf6.
moves.27. Rh2 Rad8 28. Kf1: White is not going to be able to defend his king, so in this position a more direct attack was called for.
moves.28... Qxd2 29. Qf6: White is of course one move away from mate.
moves.29... Bxe2+ 30. Kg2 Bg4+: And white is losing by force...
